net.kuujo.vertigo.cluster

Interface Cluster


  • public interface Cluster
    Client for communicating with the Vertigo cluster.

    This client is the primary API for communicating with a Vertigo cluster. Users can use the API to deploy modules, verticles, and networks or access cluster-wide shared data.

    The Vertigo cluster is a collection of modules that coordinate and communicate to remotely deploy modules and verticles and provide access to cluster-wide shared data. The Vertigo cluster does not have any master. Users can communicate with a cluster using this API or by sending messages directly to the cluster over the event bus.

    Author:
    Jordan Halterman

    • Method Detail

      • address

        String address()
        Returns the cluster address.
        Returns:
        The cluster address.

      • registerJoinHandler

        Cluster registerJoinHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<Node> handler)
        Registers a handler to be called when a node joins the cluster.

        You can also register an event bus handler to listen for nodes joining the cluster by registering a handler at {cluster}.join. The handler will receive a String message containing the absolute event bus address of the node that joined the cluster.

        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be called when the node joins the cluster.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • registerJoinHandler

        Cluster registerJoinHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<Node> handler,
                          org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Registers a handler to be called when a node joins the cluster.

        You can also register an event bus handler to listen for nodes joining the cluster by registering a handler at {cluster}.join. The handler will receive a String message containing the absolute event bus address of the node that joined the cluster.

        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be called when the node joins the cluster.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the handler has been registered.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • registerLeaveHandler

        Cluster registerLeaveHandler(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<Node> handler)
        Registers a handler to be called when a node leaves the cluster.

        You can also register an event bus handler to listen for nodes leaving the cluster by registering a handler at {cluster}.leave. The handler will receive a String message containing the absolute event bus address of the node that left the cluster.

        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be called when the node leaves the cluster.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • registerLeaveHandler

                           org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Registers a handler to be called when a node leaves the cluster.

        You can also register an event bus handler to listen for nodes leaving the cluster by registering a handler at {cluster}.leave. The handler will receive a String message containing the absolute event bus address of the node that left the cluster.

        Parameters:
        handler - A handler to be called when the node leaves the cluster.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the handler has been registered.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • getGroup

        Cluster getGroup(String address,
               org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Group>> resultHandler)
        Gets a group in the cluster.
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the group.
        resultHandler - A handler to be called with the result. If the group does not exist then a ClusterException will occur.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • getGroups

        Cluster getGroups(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Collection<Group>>> resultHandler)
        Gets a collection of groups in the cluster.
        Parameters:
        resultHandler - A handler to be called once the groups are loaded.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • selectGroup

        Cluster selectGroup(Object key,
                  org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Group>> resultHandler)
        Selects a group in the cluster according to the given key.

        The cluster guarantees that the same group will always be selected given the same key so long as the group exists in the cluster. Once the group leaves the cluster a new group will be selected.

        Parameters:
        key - The key from which to select the group.
        resultHandler - A handler to be called once complete.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • getNode

        Cluster getNode(String address,
              org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Node>> resultHandler)
        Gets a node in the cluster.
        Parameters:
        address - The address of the node.
        resultHandler - A handler to be called with the result. If the node does not exist then a ClusterException will occur.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • getNodes

        Cluster getNodes(org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Collection<Node>>> resultHandler)
        Gets a collection of nodes in the cluster.
        Parameters:

      • selectNode

        Cluster selectNode(Object key,
                 org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Node>> resultHandler)
        Selects a node in the cluster according to the given key.

        The cluster guarantees that the same node will always be selected given the same key so long as the node exists in the cluster. Once the node leaves the cluster a new node will be selected.

        Parameters:
        key - The key from which to select the group.
        resultHandler - A handler to be called once complete.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • installModule

        Cluster installModule(String moduleName)
        Installs a local module to all nodes the cluster.

        The module being installed must be available on the local classpath in the normal Vert.x mods directory. If the module is already installed on a given node then the node will be skipped, otherwise the local module will be zipped, uploaded, and installed to the node.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to install.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • installModule

        Cluster installModule(String moduleName,
                    org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Installs a local module to all nodes in the cluster.

        The module being installed must be available on the local classpath in the normal Vert.x mods directory. If the module is already installed on a given node then the node will be skipped, otherwise the local module will be zipped, uploaded, and installed to the node.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to install.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the module has been installed.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • uninstallModule

        Cluster uninstallModule(String moduleName)
        Uninstalls a module from all nodes in the cluster.

        When the module is uninstalled, it will be removed from the classpath of the remote node. This means you should not uninstall modules that were originally installed on any given node.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to uninstall.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • uninstallModule

        Cluster uninstallModule(String moduleName,
                      org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Uninstalls a module from all nodes in the cluster.

        When the module is uninstalled, it will be removed from the classpath of the remote node. This means you should not uninstall modules that were originally installed on any given node.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to uninstall.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the module has been uninstalled.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployModule

        Cluster deployModule(String moduleName)
        Deploys a module to the cluster.

        The module must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. This means ideally the module should be installed on all nodes in the cluster. You can also select a node using the helper methods provided.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to deploy.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployModule

        Cluster deployModule(String moduleName,
                   org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject config)
        Deploys a module to the cluster.

        The module must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. This means ideally the module should be installed on all nodes in the cluster. You can also select a node using the helper methods provided.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to deploy.
        config - The module configuration.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployModule

        Cluster deployModule(String moduleName,
                   org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<String>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a module to the cluster.

        The module must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. This means ideally the module should be installed on all nodes in the cluster. You can also select a node using the helper methods provided.

        Parameters:
        moduleName - The name of the module to deploy.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the module has been deployed. The handler will be called with the unique deployment ID if successful.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployVerticle

        Cluster deployVerticle(String main)
        Deploys a verticle to the cluster.

        The verticle must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. If the verticle is not available on the classpath, a ClusterException will occur. You can deploy a verticle to a specific node by using the node selection API, or by wrapping a verticle in a module Vertigo can upload and deploy the module to a specific node.

        Parameters:
        main - The verticle main.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployVerticle

        Cluster deployVerticle(String main,
                     org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject config)
        Deploys a verticle to the cluster.

        The verticle must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. If the verticle is not available on the classpath, a ClusterException will occur. You can deploy a verticle to a specific node by using the node selection API, or by wrapping a verticle in a module Vertigo can upload and deploy the module to a specific node.

        Parameters:
        main - The verticle main.
        instances - The number of instances to deploy.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployVerticle

        Cluster deployVerticle(String main,
                     int instances)
        Deploys a verticle to the cluster.

        The verticle must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. If the verticle is not available on the classpath, a ClusterException will occur. You can deploy a verticle to a specific node by using the node selection API, or by wrapping a verticle in a module Vertigo can upload and deploy the module to a specific node.

        Parameters:
        main - The verticle main.
        config - The verticle configuration.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployVerticle

        Cluster deployVerticle(String main,
                     org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject config,
                     org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<String>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a verticle to the cluster.

        The verticle must be available on whichever node receives the deploy message. If the verticle is not available on the classpath, a ClusterException will occur. You can deploy a verticle to a specific node by using the node selection API, or by wrapping a verticle in a module Vertigo can upload and deploy the module to a specific node.

        Parameters:
        main - The verticle main.
        config - The verticle configuration.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the verticle has been deployed. The handler will be called with the unique deployment ID if successful.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployVerticle

        Cluster deployVerticle(String main,
                     int instances,
                     org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<String>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a verticle to the cluster.

        instances - The number of instances to deploy.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once the verticle has been deployed. The handler will be called with the unique deployment ID if successful.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • undeployModule

        Cluster undeployModule(String deploymentID)
        Undeploys a module from the cluster.

        Given the unique module deployment ID, Vertigo will ensure that the deployment is undeployed from the appropriate node in the cluster.

        Parameters:
        deploymentID - The deployment ID of the module to undeploy.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • undeployModule

        Cluster undeployModule(String deploymentID,
                     org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)

        Given the unique module deployment ID, Vertigo will ensure that the deployment is undeployed from the appropriate node in the cluster.

        Parameters:
        deploymentID - The deployment ID of the module to undeploy.
        doneHandler - A handler to be called once complete.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • getNetwork

        Cluster getNetwork(String name,
                 org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<ActiveNetwork>> resultHandler)
        Loads a network from the cluster.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to load.
        resultHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called with the active network. If the network is not running in the cluster then a ClusterException will occur.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployNetwork

        Cluster deployNetwork(String name)
        Deploys a bare network to the cluster.

        The network will be deployed with no components and no connections. You can add components and connections to the network with an ActiveNetwork instance.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to deploy.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployNetwork

        Cluster deployNetwork(String name,
                    org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<ActiveNetwork>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a bare network to the cluster.

        The network will be deployed with no components and no connections. You can add components and connections to the network with an ActiveNetwork instance.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to deploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the network has completed deployment. The handler will be called with an ActiveNetwork instance which can be used to add or remove components and connections from the network.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployNetwork

        Cluster deployNetwork(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject network)
        Deploys a JSON network to the cluster.

        The JSON network configuration will be converted to a NetworkConfig before being deployed to the cluster. The conversion is done synchronously, so if the configuration is invalid then this method may throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        network - The JSON network configuration. For the configuration format see the project documentation.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployNetwork

        Cluster deployNetwork(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject network,
                    org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<ActiveNetwork>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a JSON network to the cluster.

        The JSON network configuration will be converted to a NetworkConfig before being deployed to the cluster. The conversion is done synchronously, so if the configuration is invalid then this method may throw an exception.

        Parameters:
        network - The JSON network configuration. For the configuration format see the project documentation.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the network has completed deployment. The handler will be called with an ActiveNetwork instance which can be used to add or remove components and connections from the network.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployNetwork

        Cluster deployNetwork(NetworkConfig network)
        Deploys a network to the cluster.

        If the given network configuration's name matches the name of a network that is already running in the cluster then the given configuration will be merged with the running network's configuration. This allows networks to be dynamically updated with partial configurations. If the configuration matches the already running configuration then no changes will occur, so it's not necessary to check whether a network is already running if the configuration has not been altered.

        Parameters:
        network - The configuration of the network to deploy.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • deployNetwork

        Cluster deployNetwork(NetworkConfig network,
                    org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<ActiveNetwork>> doneHandler)
        Deploys a network to the cluster.

        If the given network configuration's name matches the name of a network that is already running in the cluster then the given configuration will be merged with the running network's configuration. This allows networks to be dynamically updated with partial configurations. If the configuration matches the already running configuration then no changes will occur, so it's not necessary to check whether a network is already running if the configuration has not been altered.

        Parameters:
        network - The configuration of the network to deploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the network has completed deployment. The handler will be called with an ActiveNetwork instance which can be used to add or remove components and connections from the network.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • undeployNetwork

        Cluster undeployNetwork(String name)
        Undeploys a complete network from the cluster.

        This method does not require a network configuration for undeployment. Vertigo will load the configuration from the fault-tolerant data store and undeploy components internally. This allows networks to be undeployed without the network configuration.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to undeploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the network is undeployed.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • undeployNetwork

        Cluster undeployNetwork(String name,
                      org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Undeploys a complete network from the cluster.

        This method does not require a network configuration for undeployment. Vertigo will load the configuration from the fault-tolerant data store and undeploy components internally. This allows networks to be undeployed without the network configuration.

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the network to undeploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the network is undeployed.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • undeployNetwork

        Cluster undeployNetwork(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject network)
        Undeploys a network from the cluster from a json configuration.

        The JSON configuration will immediately be converted to a NetworkConfig prior to undeploying the network. In order to undeploy the entire network, the configuration should be the same as the deployed configuration. Vertigo will use configuration components to determine whether two configurations are identical. If the given configuration is not identical to the running configuration, any components or connections in the json configuration that are present in the running network will be closed and removed from the running network.

        Parameters:
        network - The JSON configuration to undeploy. For the configuration format see the project documentation.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • undeployNetwork

        Cluster undeployNetwork(org.vertx.java.core.json.JsonObject network,
                      org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Undeploys a network from the cluster from a json configuration.

        The JSON configuration will immediately be converted to a NetworkConfig prior to undeploying the network. In order to undeploy the entire network, the configuration should be the same as the deployed configuration. Vertigo will use configuration components to determine whether two configurations are identical. If the given configuration is not identical to the running configuration, any components or connections in the json configuration that are present in the running network will be closed and removed from the running network.

        Parameters:
        network - The JSON configuration to undeploy. For the configuration format see the project documentation.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the configuration is undeployed.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • undeployNetwork

        Cluster undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig network)
        Undeploys a network from the cluster.

        This method supports both partial and complete undeployment of networks. When undeploying networks by specifying a NetworkConfig, the network configuration should contain all components and connections that are being undeployed. If the configuration's components and connections match all deployed components and connections then the entire network will be undeployed.

        Parameters:
        network - The network configuration to undeploy.
        Returns:
        The cluster.

      • undeployNetwork

        Cluster undeployNetwork(NetworkConfig network,
                      org.vertx.java.core.Handler<org.vertx.java.core.AsyncResult<Void>> doneHandler)
        Undeploys a network from the cluster.

        This method supports both partial and complete undeployment of networks. When undeploying networks by specifying a NetworkConfig, the network configuration should contain all components and connections that are being undeployed. If the configuration's components and connections match all deployed components and connections then the entire network will be undeployed.

        Parameters:
        network - The network configuration to undeploy.
        doneHandler - An asynchronous handler to be called once the configuration is undeployed.
        Returns:
        The cluster.
